physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cachectic, symmetric microcephaly characteristic of William's syndrome, thin neck with jugular venous pulsations, thin hair and beard, normal pulmonary examination except for diminished breath sounds bilaterally, regular heart rate and rhythm with audible fourth heart sound and left-sided diastolic murmur, retracted and scaphoid abdomen with hyperactive bowel sounds after meals, strikingly thin extremities with severely atrophied musculature, presence of brachydactyly and clinodactyly bilaterally, no detectable edema, generalized psychomotor slowing.
